[Spoken Outro]
I'm... there's always a song, every album, one or two - not every album, I believe there's some where that's not true - where Peter Hughes has a special feeling for. I treasure these songs. I'm always like, y'know, part of the fun dynamic of writing an album is thinking, oh Wurster will be able to chew this one up, or whatever. The ones I feel Peter will connect to and feel like I actually dug a little and found a, y'know, Peter has an ear for what I call fine feeling, where it's not spelling it out, it's rendering something, like a pastel or watercolor and then you have to sort of look at it long enough to get what's going on. I feel like that's sort of Peter's zone, right? This is my read on you. Uh, you know, like the go-betweens, like not spelling it out planely. Speaking planely, but not spelling it out planely, right? So, this is one of those, right? And plus, Peter had like this amazing experience with an aquarium once in Australia where he went for a walk really tired and stood before some fish and like got really emotional. And you, we've all been there. I was thinking that as I was writing it. And so, when he got the demos, he went, oh I really like this song, and I was pleased. And we tracked it, I was actually had my doubts, because it's so even, I don't yell or anything and I'm always worried about the ones where I don't raise my voice much. But then it came out so nice and I was like, ah, this is gonna be great live. But then the plague happened, you know, and then we didn't get to go play it live, so that was really great. That's the end of that story
We're the Mountain Goats and this next song is called "Picture of My Dress"Embed

title: History of the Church (Part 1)
lyrics:
1 ContributorHistory of the Church (Part 1) LyricsIn the early days of the Christian Church
There was a movement among freethinking Christians called Gnosticism
Now the Gnostics believed that the incarnation of Christ had been entirely illusory
And their reasoning was as follows
That if God is holy and the body is unholy
Then God would not inhabit a body
Hence people had been seeing things when Christ walked the earth

Now about this time lived a man named Polycarp
Polycarp had received his teaching at the hands of John the Apostle
It was Polycarp's earnest belief that the Gnostics wеre heretics
And hе visited Rome to tell them so

He met up with a guy named Marcion
Extremely influential among the Gnostics
And Marcion, realizing Polycarp's status at having studied under John the Apostle
Demanded that he be recognized
